intro: Cinchona caloptera, commonly known as the white cinchona, is a species of tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
